intro: Pachecoa guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan pachecoa, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, palmate leaves. The plant produces vibrant, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
